A few notes:

  1. Indexing a single dimension of multi-dimensional arrays is slower than it should be because it expands the indexing tensor to individual elements. This should be fixed.
  2. index_select has an incorrect gradient when indices repeat. That's why put with accumulate=True is slower than put with accumulate=False. Perhaps we can figure out a way to specify that indices don't repeat but I think fixing (1) is more urgent.

body:
A few notes:

1. Indexing a single dimension of multi-dimensional arrays is slower than it should be because it expands the indexing tensor to individual elements. This should be fixed.
2. `index_select` has an incorrect gradient when indices repeat. That's why `put` with `accumulate=True` is slower than `put` with `accumulate=False`. Perhaps we can figure out a way to specify that indices don't repeat but I think fixing (1) is more urgent.
